links.to_node: not share the account, asking everyone to pay for one instead.
Your family may be disappointed or frustrated that you are not willing to share your HBO account, especially if they were looking forward to watching Game of Thrones together.
There may be tension or conflict within your family as a result of your decision, particularly if they feel that you are being selfish or uncooperative.
Your family may decide to go ahead and get their own HBO account, which could lead to additional expenses for everyone involved.
You may feel a sense of relief and autonomy by not sharing your account, as it allows you to continue watching what you want without fear of judgment or interference.
Your relationship with your family, particularly your brother, may be strained if they perceive your decision as a lack of support or willingness to compromise.
You may miss out on the opportunity to bond with your family over a shared interest in Game of Thrones, which could impact your sense of connection and belonging within the family.
